content.title: Intro
content.content:

Year

Tolkien-related events that took place in 1989.

content.title: January
content.content:
5 - The Return of the Shadow is published in the US.
27 - Actor David Buck dies.
? - J.R.R. Tolkien: Man of Fantasy is published.
? - Vinyar Tengwar 3 is published.

content.title: February
content.content: 24 - Stella M. Mills, student under J.R.R. Tolkien, dies.

content.title: March
content.content:
11 - Actor John Wyse dies.
17 - Actress Morfydd Clark is born.
19 - Heren Hyarmen, the Brazilian Tolkien Society, is founded.
28 - Actor Lockwood West dies.
? - Vinyar Tengwar 4 is published.
? - Beyond Bree March 1989 is published.

content.title: May
content.content:
3 - Actor William Squire dies.
? - Vinyar Tengwar 5 is published.

content.title: June
content.content:
16 - Actor John Westbrook dies.
25 - The first meeting of members of the Elvish Linguistic Fellowship takes place at the residence of Bill Welden.
? - Vinyar Tengwar 6 is published.

content.title: September
content.content:
1 - Oliphaunt is published.
7 - The Treason of Isengard is published in the UK.
22-24 - Oxonmoot 1989.
? - Vinyar Tengwar 7 is published.
? - Mallorn 26 is published.

content.title: November
content.content:
30 - The Treason of Isengard is published in the US.
? - Vinyar Tengwar, Issue 8 is published.

content.title: December
content.content:
2 - Norman Davis dies.
16 - Actress Marjorie Westbury dies.

? - The 1990 J.R.R. Tolkien Calendar is released.
? - J.R.R. Tolkien - Master of Middle Earth Calendar 1990 is released.
? - The 1990 NOT Tolkien Calendar is released.
? - Storybook Collection - Rodney Mathews 1990 Calendar is released.
? - Inklings Calendar 1990 is released.
? - Tolkien Calendar 1990 is released.
? - Denizens of the Dark Wood is published.
? - Lords of Middle-earth: Vol. III is published.
? - Perils on the Sea of Rh√ªn is published.
? - Warlords of the Desert is published.
? - Dark Mage of Rhudaur is published.
? - Forest of Tears is published.
? - Ghosts of the Southern Anduin is published.
? - Empire of the Witch-king is published.
? - The premiere of the Slovak radio adaptation Hobit on Czechoslovak public radio.
